meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! I'm back, and this time I'm all about Stranded: Alien Dawn. Now, I know what you're thinking - another survival game? But bear with me, folks! This one's got some serious charm.

First off, let me just say that Haemimont Games has done an admirable job of borrowing from the best (RimWorld and The Sims, anyone?) and still managing to make their own mark. The gameplay is solid - you build a colony on an alien planet, manage resources, craft new tools, and try not to get yourself killed by those pesky space critters. It's all very familiar, yet still engaging.

Now, I know some of my fellow critics might be saying things like "It could stand to have more scenarios" (GamingTrend) or "It needs more variety in combat and everyday life" (GameStar). And yeah, those are valid points. But honestly? I was too busy having fun building a space base with my alien friends to worry about that stuff.

The real magic happens when you start making choices that have lasting impact. Want to focus on research and development? You might just unlock some game-changing tech (literally!). Or maybe you'll decide to prioritize food production and end up with a thriving colony... or, you know, a bunch of hungry space creatures eating your lunch.

What's most impressive is how the game seems to cater to different playstyles. If you're more into building and optimizing, you can do just that. But if you're looking for some good ol' fashioned survival horror vibes? Haemimont's got you covered there too.

Now, I won't lie - some of my fellow reviewers might be a bit harsher than me. PC Gamer calls it a "survival colony builder" (fair enough!), while God is a Geek says it "borrows from RimWorld and The Sims" (yup, that's true!). But hey, at least they're acknowledging the game's influences - I mean, who doesn't love a good bit of intergalactic Sims-ing?

All in all, Stranded: Alien Dawn is a great little package. It won't change your life or anything, but it'll keep you busy for dozens of hours and might just become your new go-to survival fix.

That's it for me - Hippo Penny out!
